page.title: 11Table Tennis at Stow Maries
page.content: The club started in Cold Norton in 1979. It is now held at Smythe Hall in Stow Maries and members meet on Tuesday, Wednesday and one other night There are now 5 teams increasing to 9 next year. The A team has just been promoted to division 1 in the Burnham and District league and the C team into division 2. The members who pay Â£1 a night, range in age from 12 to 50+.They play regular league matches and compete in the Tiptree Tournament in March. The club secretary, B Cook won the club tournament trophy this year, which was presented by Frank Boyle. 2/3 of the members come from Cold Norton, Frank Boyle and his daughter from Stow Maries, 3 from Canvey Island 1 from Rayleigh and one from Maldon. This is a very successful club which is expanding rapidly.
